page.title: 01Introduction to the Area.
page.content: Most of the area is farmland. The river Coquet runs through the South perimeter of the area. There are country walks by the river.Felton village grew as a crossing point over the river for the A1.There are two bridges;an old pack horse bridge and a modern bridge. In 1981 a bypass was opened and the A1 traffic now travels West of Felton. Many of the old houses are built of stone and line the main road. In 1939 Council houses were built at the North end of the village and in 1984 a new estate was built further North. Some families have lived in Felton for many generations. There are many clubs,societies and amenities established in Felton for local people. The market towns of Alnwick and Morpeth lie 15km to the North and South respectively.
